page.title: 15Peoples memories of Fetcham
page.content: The first years interviewed people who had lived in the village for several years,to find out what they remembered.Nearly everyone remarked on how the village had grown. More houses,shops and roads but most still liked living here. The longest resident was 73 years ,"born and bred" here. Many remembered things like gas or oil lighting. Lamps had to be filled and wicks changed daily. There was no light upstairs (except candles) and only one tap (cold). Some cooked on a range while everyone had open fires _ often using logs.One small boy used to spend Saturday chopping wood for people who were unable to chop their own. They did their own washing up by hand over a bucket or a tub with a wash board . Or they used a copper kettle
